sen.j: 慶祚（けいそ、天暦9年（955年）- 寛仁3年12月22日 (旧暦)（1020年1月19日））は、平安時代中期の天台宗の僧。
sen.e: Keiso (955-January 19, 1020) is a priest of Tendai Sect in the mid Heian Era.
Keiso (955-January 19, 1020) was a priest of the Tendai Sect during the mid Heian Era.
Keiso (955 - January 25, 1020) was a priest of the Tendai sect during the mid Heian period.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。Era →period としました。

sen.e: His secular name is the Nakahara Clan.
His secular name was from the Nakahara Clan.
His secular surname was Nakahara.

sen.j: 園城寺の余慶について天台教学を学ぶ。
sen.e: Keiso studied Tendai doctrine under Yokei of Enjo-ji Temple.
Keiso studied the Tendai doctrine under Yokei of Enjo-ji Temple.
Keiso studied the Tendai doctrine under Yokei of Onjo-ji Temple.

sen.j: 正暦4年（993年）比叡山から円珍の門徒が追放された際、慶祚も岩倉大雲寺その後園城寺に移った。
sen.e: When the disciples of Enchin were kicked out of the Hiei-zan Mountain in 993, Keiso also moved first to Iwakura Daiun-ji Temple and then to Enjo-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When the disciples of Enchin were kicked out of Hiei-zan Mountain in 993, Keiso moved first to Iwakura Daiun-ji Temple and then to Enjo-ji Temple.
When the disciples of Enchin were kicked out of Mt. Hiei in 993, Keiso moved first to Iwakura Daiun-ji Temple and then to Onjo-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: Mt. Hiei, Onjo-ji と修正しました。

sen.j: 慶祚の学徳を慕って多くの学徒が集まり園城寺における天台教学興隆の基となった。
sen.e: Many gakutos (scholar monks) attracted to Keiso for his deep knowledge and virtue gathered around him, building a basis for prosperity of Tendai Sect at Enjo-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Many gakutos (scholar monks) were attracted to Keiso for his deep knowledge and virtue and gathered around him, building a basis for prosperity of the Tendai Sect at Enjo-ji Temple.
Many scholar priests were attracted to Keiso for his deep knowledge and virtue and gathered around him, building a basis for prosperity of the Tendai sect at Onjo-ji Temple.

sen.j: 997年（長徳3年）朝命を受けて宋から送られてきた「竜女成仏義」を批判している。
sen.e: In 997, upon the order of Imperial court, Keiso criticized "Ryujo jobutsugi (Principle of Attaining Buddhahood for Ryujo)"sent from Sung.
sen.cmt: 「竜女」は「りゅうじょ」「りゅうにょ」二通りの読み方があるようです。
sen.e: In 997, upon the order of the Imperial court, Keiso criticized "Ryujo jobutsugi (Principle of Attaining Buddhahood for Ryujo)"sent from Sung.
In 997, upon the order of the Imperial Court, Keiso criticized 'Ryujo jobutsugi' (Principle of Attaining Buddhahood for Ryujo) sent from Sung Dynasty.

sen.j: 寛仁元年（1017年）の円珍忌に法華十講を行った。
sen.e: In 1017 Keiso lectured on Hoke-kyo Sutra in eight volumes, Kai-kyo (sutra read before the main sutra) and Kechi-kyo (sutra read after the main sutra) at the memorial service for Enchin.
In 1017 Keiso lectured on Hoke-kyo Sutra in eight volumes, Kai-kyo (sutra read before the main sutra) and Kechi-kyo (sutra read after the main sutra) at a memorial service for Enchin.

In 1017 Keiso performed Hokke Juko (lectures on Hoke-kyo Sutra in eight volumes, Kai-kyo [sutra read before the main sutra] and Kechi-kyo [sutra read after the main sutra]) at a memorial service for Enchin.
sen.cmt: Hokke Juko を追加しました。

sen.j: 学識で知られ、増賀や源信_(僧侶)にも仰がれた。
sen.e: Keiso was known for his deep knowledge and was respected by Zoga and Genshin (monk).
Keiso was known for his deep knowledge and was respected by Zoga and Genshin (monks).
Keiso was known for his deep knowledge and was respected by Zoga and Genshin (priest).
sen.cmt: monk →priest として統一しました。
